India ek democratic desh hai aur abhi tak dictatorship ki koi indication nahi hai. Bharat ka political system democracy par adharit hai, jismein citizens ka authority hota hai apne leaders ko chunne mein. India ke constitution mein fundamental rights aur checks and balances hain jo democracy ko strengthen karte hain.

Haal hi mein, kuch logon ne concerns express ki hai regarding the state of democracy in India, jaise ki freedom of speech, media independence, aur minority rights. Lekin, yeh concerns usually democracy ko question karne ke liye nahi hai balki unka aim hai system ko improve karna.

Democracy mein hota hai ki different political parties compete karte hain elections ke through, aur power peacefully transfer hoti hai. India mein bhi regularly elections hote hain aur power peacefully transfer hoti hai, jo democracy ke signs hain.

Iske alawa, India mein independent judiciary bhi hai jo constitution ko protect karta hai aur checks and balances provide karta hai government ke actions ke against. Overall, India abhi tak democracy mein hai aur dictatorship ki koi indication nahi hai.

Mere paas ek political idea hai agar koi interested hai desh k liye kuchh karne ko me 23 saal ka hun or mujhe 30-35 saal k intelect approach wale larke ladkiyan chahiye ek party banane k liye, par isme kuchh conditions hai, wo is tarha hai ki-
1. Maa baap bhai bahan ko bhulna hoga.
2. Humara basic idea hoga kisi political party ko criticise nahi karna bass apna agenda logon ko batana.
3. Hum or political parties ki tarha janta k pichhe nahi chale ge satta k liye, iski bajay hum janta ko bhi criticise karenge kyuki har desh ki barbaadi ya vikaas me sarkaar 50% or janta 50% ke bhagidaar hote hai
4. Me ek ese manifesto pe kaam kar raha hun jo logon ko chubh sakta hai, iske bajaye humari party marte dum tak elections lade gi chahe power me aye ya na aye
5. Party members ko atmagyan bhi hona chahiye jo bohot zaroori hai

Menifestow k kuchh keypoints is tarha hai-
1. Climate change k liye ped katne par poori tarha pabandi
2. Luxuries or vip culture, private jet jaisi sabhi betuki chizo par pabandi
3. Ek naya refill system jisme products refill kiye jayenge bajay repers me packaging k
4. Eco conditioned recycling ko full impact se lagu karenge
5. AQI index ko impliment or normalise karenge
6. Nai jobs ke saath saath 8 hrs shift system layen ge, jis se ye hoga ki ek job ko 24 hrs k hisaab se 3 log kar payenge, or per hr wage system lagu hoga
7.minimalism, spiritualism, libralism, rationalism approach rakhengeor education system me layenge
8. Mp, mla, cm, pm, secretary, rashtrapati sabhi ki luxuries kam karenge uni security se compromise kiye bina.
9. Sare government officials ki pay bhi ek aam teacher jitni hogi
10. Jis cheez ki sab baat karte hai ki army ki payrate teachers se jada hogi matlab payrate kaam k nature k hisaab se hi milega
11. Har ek decision jo pm, cm, mp, mla office me baithe lenge uski videography hogi.
12. Police, army, raw, cbi, ed, it sabhi institutions jo direct control me hai center k un sabhi ko partiall controll kiya jayega jise 10 vote ki bench control karegi.
13. Har ek decision lene se pehle pannel discission hogi poore desh ke saath jisme 4 votes governance, 3 vote janta, 2 votes burocrats or special intelective bodies,or 1 vote opposition ka hoga
14. Technology ki help se ek tempad system laya jayega jis se ye hoga ki sabhi ko ek electronic pad diya jayega jisme uski saari details hongi data security se compromise kiye bina sare paper document ko poori tarha abolish kiya jayega, voting bhi convinient ho jayegi is se
15. Koi janta ka khoon 5 saal na chus saake iske liye sare elections ek hi din honge chahe wo mp, mla, cm, ya pm ho, ya sarpanch, har term 5 saal k bajaye 2 saal hi hogi
16. Rapists ko gunah sabit hone par janta k mat ke hisaab se fansi hogi, jisse koi rapist nahi bachega chahe wo mp ka larka ho mla ka ya cm pm ka kyuki, police politicians k control me nahi hogi
17. Foriegn standards ke hisaab se industries par limitations hongi co2 emmisions ko leke
18. India ek diverted nation hai, jahan 300000 se bhi jyada villages hai, jis se transport ka kharcha developed countries se 10├Ч zyada hota hai, iske liye city centric approach hogi jaise australia ne ki hai

Or bhi points hai jiske zariye hum desh ki janta ko sirf sach parosenge, humari education system me vedaantic ideology ko importance di jayegi, is liye jo is unche kaam ko karne k liye apne saare bandhan tod sakta hai or saari umar sangharsh or dard seh sakta hai wo mujhe contact kare hum ek saath ek whatsapp group banayenge jisme judne k baad hum sab milenge ek jagah par or age k baare me sochenge,

You have been making great videos. I appreciate your courage. However as per current scenario, we need to learn few things and adapt accordingly. 

Problem Statement- 
We have been seeing how political parties are a cartel for looting public money. If top persons in a political party are corrupt, then people funding those parties can get anything done as per their will. Root of the problem lies in funding elections. Anyone who is funding elections will need favor from the elected person. We can see one person getting major contracts for ports, natural resources, monopoly in cement and whatever he desires. 

How can we tackle it ? 
Since a lot of money goes into corruption which is loss to government, it is better to fund the election by the state. Expenditure by government will be much less that what it loses due to corruption. 
As elected members dont have obligation to funding, they will be more free and unbiased in serving people. It will be difficult for the fat pockets to buy elected members everywhere. 

Also, good and honest people will have a chance to win the elections whereas in the current system, criminals and corrupt people are winning due to muscle and money power.  

Selection of candidate process- Those who want to stand for elections can nominate themselves. Nominated persons will have to face panel interviews to showcase their understanding of social and economic development of people. Only those who can qualify interview should be allowed to run for election before the public. This is to prevent fake nominations and publicity stunts. Now selected persons can explain their development plans, promises and roadmap to the public by TV,  internet and radio  debates . These shows should be on government's expenditure. As only selected candidates will be there, this should not be huge burden on the exchequer. People can select their candidates from these nominated people whomsoever they like. 

We need to change our system as early as possible and people should understand this. People should unite to remove political party system else we will be carried away by these corrupts.

Leave what certain party did and did not in the past but based on their current menifesto, i will give a  plain and simple explanation who and why I vote for in this election..
I am from middle class family and not from any of the minority cast/religion. Through out my school i maintained 80 to 85% grades. In the BBA entrance exam i got 83 percentile and one of my peers got 58 percentile. Yet she got in to the well reputed goverment college  because she was from schedule cast and i had to go to the private one with 10 times more fees because i am from a general cast. (Not to forget, her dad already has a government job with a very good income, again because of their cast.) And same thing happened for my MBA exam. Now while finding a job, she got a job at a better company, position and salary then me just because she had a degree from a better college. Fast forward to 8 years later, she was my superior with significantly higher salary. So out of humiliation and desperation, i sell everything i have and start a business. After working day and night for four years, i finally become more successful and richear than that girl.
Now certain party comes and say that "jiski jitni aabadi uska utna haq." Which basically means, they will take my hard earn money away and 2ill give to the people who otherwise always been privileged.
Is it really my fault that i am from genetal category ot so called higher cast? Is it my fault that i am a hard working person? Why in my right mind would vote for the people who wants to steal my money?
Even i believe in multiple strong options so that one party doesn't become arrogant and irresponsible. But based on current scenario, what other option do i have?

Dear Dhruv Rathee,

I've been a follower of your work for the past 5-6 years, watching nearly all your videos and eagerly sharing them with my family. Your content has always stood out to me for its informative and fact-based approach. I even encourage my children to watch your channel and quiz them on the videos to ensure they're learning alongside me. Your impact on us has been significant, and we value the knowledge you've shared over the years.

However, I've noticed a shift in your content over the past year. It seems like you've strayed from your core focus of knowledge-sharing and instead embarked on what appears to be a mission to oppose the government. Let me clarify that I'm not affiliated with any political party, but I can't help but feel concerned about this apparent agenda in your recent videos. While I acknowledge the challenges our country faces, I believe there have been positive developments as well, which seem overlooked in your content.

You mentioned in your videos that you've covered positive aspects too, but it feels like the ratio of positive to negative coverage is heavily skewed. This deviation from your usual balanced approach is disheartening for your genuine followers like me. Your content now feels more like activism rather than informative discourse. On one hand, you highlight how the media is under government control, yet on the other, you seem to selectively present facts that oppose the government, neglecting instances of good governance.

As someone who genuinely wishes the best for you, I urge you to remain neutral and provide unbiased viewpoints. We long to see the original Dhruv Rathee who enlightened us with knowledge and information and whose tagline was тАЬExplainers that InspireтАЭ, not one on a mission to constantly oppose the government. This shift in your content has generated negativity and could tarnish your image. I'm not sure if this message will reach you, but I felt compelled to share my concerns.

Thanks

Dear Dhruv Rathee,

I wish to extend my deepest gratitude for your recent video that casts light on the concerning actions of our Prime Minister. Your unwavering courage to speak truth to power is not only commendable but serves as a beacon for democratic values in these troubling times.

Your meticulous research, clear presentation, and the bravery to tackle such sensitive issues head-on are truly admirable. Your efforts help foster an informed citizenry and hold those in power accountable, which is the cornerstone of any healthy democracy.

In a climate where the drift towards authoritarianism seems to loom over us, voices like yours are essential to maintain the checks and balances that prevent such a shift. You are not just a content creator; you are a guardian of transparency and a champion for the collective conscience of our nation.

I salute you for your dedication to truth and justice. May your resolve remain steadfast, and may your voice continue to inspire action and awareness among us all.

Thank you again for your valiant efforts.

With utmost respect and solidarity, Best Regards, Anand.

The basic structure doctrine of the Indian Constitution protects the Constitution from arbitrary changes or violations.┬аThe doctrine states that any amendment that tries to change the basic structure of the constitution is invalid.┬а

The basic structure doctrine includes the following fundamental features of the Constitution that cannot be amended or abrogated by Parliament:

The supremacy of the Constitution

Democracy

Federalism

Secularism

The protection of fundamental rights

The rule of law┬а

The tenth schedule of the Constitution is also known as the Anti-defection act. As per this act, any MLA or MP who changes parties will be disqualified. A person elected on a party symbol has to continue being a member from the same party. If they change parties, they will be disqualified and will lose their seat. So buying a mla is absolutely useless

The pathetic fall of print and electronic media into the hands of the mighty,  the unprecedented control of otherwise fairly independent Institutions and the anti religious rhetoric against few communities are a clear sign of degradation of democratic freedom. 
Unfortunately majority of the free thinking public have been mesmerised by the mighty and powerful lobby to be a silent follower or a vociferous supporter.  If this trend continues for another decade,  it will be too late and India would have suffered the damage. 
There is no point in regretting after the damage is done. 
Don't be so blind to the reality due to political affiliation. 
I am not an ardent supporter of any political party.  But definitely is concerned with the way the media and Institutions are mere toys in the hands of the mighty. Personalities like TN Seshan are born once in a century only.  Hence any retrieval of Institutions are unlikely.  The worst situation in a democracy is that one side is so week and other side is so mighty and that's our picture today.

Sir, I really admire your content because you don't unnecessarily add extra spice or twists for views. It's really sad that Indian news channels have become unworthy of watching; they've turned into entertainment channels resembling reality shows. It's almost laughable to see news channels prioritizing TRP over delivering genuine news. There's hardly any respect left for Indian journalists and reporters, especially due to the behavior of news channel reporters and journalists who try to portray themselves as high authorities or celebrities. It's very disheartening to witness the state of the media. In the past, news used to be so impactful during our childhood, even a single newspaper could make a difference. However, there are still some individuals, especially the youth, who want to bring about change in India. It's a great thing that we have social media now, which, if used correctly, can bring about significant change. Just like you, Mr. Dhurv Rathe, the way you present news to the public with complete proof and facts requires a lot of courage to take such steps. This is what a news channel should strive for, and this is the essence of journalism. Sir, we will always support you, and in the future, we hope you continue to enlighten the public with real facts. Wishing you a very happy life! ЁЯОЙ

I have been pondering over this thought from a very long time. How the meaning of democracy has lost its essence, the same way how the meaning of patriotism has. Repeatedly, I have noticed a disconcerting trend in your political videos тАУ a tendency to showcase accusations and present only selective truths. For instance, the composition of this committee, comprising the Prime Minister, Leader of the Opposition, and the Chief Justice of India, along with the transitional role of the CJI until legislative action is taken, was inadequately represented, creating a skewed narrative.

People like Dhruv Rathee are in fact insulting the mandate of the people of this country by making such wild allegations. India faced attacks in the past from many people and will continue to face, but its roots are so strong and deep that one individual can't dictate the direction of the country if its against its core value sytem. If Dhruv Rathee wants to make changes in the system, then instead of running a youtube channel and earning millions to through viewership remuneration, he should jump into politics and do his bit to make changes he wants to see in the society.
Its very easy passing judgement giving some cherry picked references but its hard to toil on the ground and bring social change.
Today's opposition parties represent the cocktail of the ills than India faced in last seventy five years. And when you are down with an illness you need bitter pill. Modi represents the bitter pill to free the society today from such disease. You may not like its taste, but it certainly is the cure for the kind of cancer that India was infected with in 2013. If Mr. Vajpayee was a much gentle medicine , Modi is a much stronger medicine, which is the need of the current times. And people like you will understand this only after a decade.

Title: The Tyranny of Dictatorship: A Call for Liberty

In the annals of history, the shadows of tyranny have often been cast by the figure of a single individual тАУ the dictator. Dictatorship, with its iron grip on power, stifles the very essence of freedom and democracy. As we stand at the crossroads of civilization, it is imperative to reflect on the perils of unchecked authority and the paramount importance of preserving individual liberties.

The ascent to dictatorship is often paved with promises of stability and prosperity, yet it invariably leads to oppression and suffering for the masses. The consolidation of power into the hands of a single ruler breeds corruption, nepotism, and a disregard for the rule of law. Under the guise of protecting the nation, dissent is silenced, media is muzzled, and opposition is crushed. The rights of citizens are trampled upon, and basic human dignity is compromised.

History bears witness to the catastrophic consequences of unchecked authoritarianism. From the totalitarian regimes of the 20th century to the present-day autocrats, the footprints of oppression leave scars on societies for generations to come. The erosion of civil liberties, the suppression of minority voices, and the subjugation of independent institutions are the hallmarks of dictatorship.

However, the human spirit is indomitable. Throughout history, brave souls have risen to challenge the yoke of tyranny, often at great personal sacrifice. The struggle for freedom and democracy is a timeless endeavor, one that transcends borders and ideologies. It is a testament to the innate desire for dignity and justice that resides within every human heart.

In the face of tyranny, it is incumbent upon the international community to stand in solidarity with those who yearn for freedom. Diplomatic pressure, economic sanctions, and support for grassroots movements can serve as powerful tools in the fight against dictatorship. Furthermore, fostering a culture of democracy and human rights education is essential in safeguarding against the allure of authoritarianism.

In conclusion, the specter of dictatorship looms large in our world, threatening the very foundations of liberty and democracy. Yet, it is in times of adversity that the resilience of humanity shines brightest. Let us heed the lessons of history and unite in our commitment to uphold the principles of freedom, equality, and justice for all. For in the words of Franklin D. Roosevelt, "The only sure bulwark of continuing liberty is a government strong enough to protect the interests of the people, and a people strong enough and well enough informed to maintain its sovereign control over the government."
